entry.title: Armenia‚Äôs EU bid ‚Äònot very likely,‚Äô finance minister tells CivilNet: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs EU bid ‚Äònot very likely,‚Äô finance minister tells CivilNet: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia‚Äôs finance minister poured cold water on the country‚Äôs potential to join the European Union, telling CivilNet his agency is not currently planning for that scenario. üìç Interview with Armenia‚Äôs Finance Minister Vahe Hovhannisyan: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3BsnRQR2IoA üìç Operations at Amulsar, Armenia‚Äôs long-stalled gold mine, can begin as soon as next spring, a senior Eurasian Development Bank official suggests. üìç Armenia‚Äôs government is facing a historic, $1.2B lawsuit from Walnort Finance, which owns a 12.5% stake in the Zangezur Copper-Molybdenum Combine, Armenia‚Äôs biggest mine.

Sponsored Content: This video is an advertisement.
The Small-Scale Energy-Efficiency Solutions for Rural People in the Republic of Armenia initiative is implemented by the Armenian representative office of the German Sparkassenstiftung for International Cooperation (DSIK). The initiative is implemented within the framework of the EU4Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy in Armenian Communities Project, co-funded by the European Union (EU) and the German Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ), and implemented by Deutsche Gesellschaft f√ºr Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) GmbH as a part of the ECOserve program.
The target of the initiative is the rural population of Armenia‚Äôs Tavush, Lori, Shirak, Gegharkunik and Syunik regions, including those forcibly displaced from Nagorno-Karabakh and their host communities.

entry.title: Armenia may hold referendum on joining EU ‚Äòin near future‚Äô

media:group.media:title: Armenia may hold referendum on joining EU ‚Äòin near future‚Äô
media:group.media:description:
üìç Russia hit back in unusually strong terms at remarks from Armenia‚Äôs security chief suggesting that the Kremlin allowed Azerbaijan to take control of Nagorno-Karabakh. üìç Armenia‚Äôs top diplomat said his country is willing to sign normalization deals with Azerbaijan and Turkey within a month. Azerbaijan‚Äôs top diplomat indicated ‚Äúsignificant progress‚Äù toward a deal, but again called on Armenia to change its constitution first. üìç A senior U.S. diplomat said now ‚Äúis the time for peace‚Äù between Yerevan and Baku. üìç Armenia‚Äôs parliament speaker raised the possibility of holding a referendum in the country on joining the European Union. He did not provide a timeline for that. üìç Insights with Eric Hacopian: https://youtu.be/_3WJnz5JLqY

entry.title: Armenia boosts deterrence efforts with key military procurements from New Delhi

media:group.media:title: Armenia boosts deterrence efforts with key military procurements from New Delhi
media:group.media:description:
In this episode, Economic Times columnist Manu Pubby joins Civilnet to discuss Armenia and India's burgeoning partnership across defense, trade, and emerging security sector. Pubby provides expert assessment of India's strategic goals and motivations in boosting engagement with Armenia through military aid and arms shipments. The discussion also examines the regional implications of the growing defense relationship between the Eurasian partners.

media:group.media:title: French Weapons and Baku Tears
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of Insights, host Eric Hacopian delves into Armenia's recent acquisition of advanced self-propelled Caesar 155mm howitzers from France. He explains why obtaining these elite artillery systems, renowned as some of the best in the world, significantly strengthens Armenia's defense capabilities. Eric also analyzes the geopolitical implications of this milestone deal and what it means for regional military balances going forward.
